page.title: 05LAND STRUCTURE
page.content: THE COLOUR OF THE SOIL IN THE FIELDS AROUND KENN AND KENNFORD IS RED.THIS COLOUR COMES FROM THE TRIASSIC SANDSTONE OF THE AREA. THE HIGHLANDS OF THE HALDON HILLS ARE MADE UP OF GREENSAND WITH A COVERING OF FLINT GRAVEL.THE RED SANDSTONE LEADS TO RED COLOURED STREAMS AT TIMES OF HEAVY RAIN AS THE WATER MAKES ITS WAY TO THE RIVER KENN AND THEN THE RIVER EXE. THE RIVER KENN PASSES THROUGH THE TWO THE VILLAGES,KENNFORD DERIVING IT NAME FROM A FORDING POINT OF THIS RIVER.SANDSTONE FROM TREHILL QUARRY WAS USED TO BUILD THE CHURCH OF ST ANDREW IN KENN DURING THE 14TH CENTURY .THIS GIVES THE BUILDING ALONG WITH OTHERS IN THE AREA A DEEP RED COLOURATION.
